DataElement.preferredName: Brief Fatigue Inventory Last Week Have Felt Unusual Fatigue Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of whether or not they have felt unusually tired or fatigued in the last week, using a yes or no response.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brief Fatigue Inventory Last Week Have Felt Unusual Fatigue
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 9-item questionnaire, developed by Cleeland and Mendoza, designed to assess the severity of fatigue and the impact of fatigue on daily functioning in cancer patients._The most recent week, including today._A question about whether an individual feels or felt unusual fatigue.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 9-item questionnaire, developed by Cleeland and Mendoza, designed to assess the severity of fatigue and the impact of fatigue on daily functioning in cancer patients.

Concepts.definition: A 9-item questionnaire, developed by Cleeland and Mendoza, designed to assess the severity of fatigue and the impact of fatigue on daily functioning in cancer patients.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Have Felt Unusual Fatigue
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question about whether an individual feels or felt unusual fatigue.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about whether an individual feels or felt unusual fatigue.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Throughout our lives, most of
ReferenceDocuments.description: Throughout our lives, most of us have times when we feel very tired or fatigued. Have you felt unusually tired or fatigued in the last week?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BFI Scoring
ReferenceDocuments.description: A global fatigue score can be obtained by averaging all the items on the BFI.

DataElement.origin: BFI:Brief Fatigue Inventory. Dr. Charles S. Cleeland, The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center, 1997.
